_header: It doth harm and hate done harm
_description: Death comes unexpectedly — one quatrain translating ‘Et nocet et nocuit semper differre paratis / Qui non est hodie cras minus aptus erit’ which precedes it in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
It doth harm & hat don harmTo putten forth þe timeHe
                    þat kepth him nouth today fro harmTo morwen may gon to pine
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 24.
